guntur.description: Guntur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the twenty-five lok sabha constituencies of Andhra Pradesh in India. It comprises seven assembly segments and belongs to Guntur district.[1] It was constituted in 1989 and N. G. Ranga was the first member of parliament (MP) from the constituency. Galla Jayadev is currently serving as the MP since 2014, who won the 2014 and 2019 Lok Sabha elections representing Telugu Desam Party.[2][3]

makum.name: Makum
makum.description: Makum (IPA: mɑːkəm) is a town and a town area committee in Tinsukia district in the Indian state of Assam. It should not be mistaken for Makum Pathar (the place near Digboi where, crude oil was first struck in Asia). It is the meeting point of three premier towns of upper Assam namely Tinsukia Digboi and Doomdooma. The National Highway-37 and National Highway-38 meet at Makum. Makum railway station is the easternmost railway junction of the Indian Railways. The rail line became operational on 16 July 1883.[1]

benipur.description:
Benipur Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Darbhanga district of  Bihar, India. It is 30 km east from Darbhanga city. SH 56 connecting Benipur to Darbhanga City. Neighboring villages are Mahinam, Balha, Benipur, Karhari, Nandapatti, phohddi, Ashapur. There is a railway station name "Benipur Balha" which is in Balha Village. Benipur Block is heart of benipur because of its popularity for its market. This block is second most big market in 20 square km area. Bahera market is one of the big market area very adjacent to Benipur.
Mayor: Surendra kumar jha
Deputy mayor: Zafiruddn Khan

alinagar.description: Alinagar Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Darbhanga district in the Indian state of Bihar.

darbhangarural.name: Darbhanga Rural
darbhangarural.description: Darbhanga Rural Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Darbhanga district in the Indian state of Bihar. It is an open seat from 2010 but was earlier reserved for scheduled castes.

darbhanga.name: Darbhanga
darbhanga.description: Darbhanga Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Darbhanga district in the Indian state of Bihar.

bahadurpur.name: Bahadurpur
bahadurpur.description: Bahadurpur Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Darbhanga district in the Indian state of Bihar.

darbhanga.description: Darbhanga Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.[1] Currently Gopal Jee Thakur of Bhartiya Janta Party is the Member of Parliament from Darbhanga Loksabha.

muzaffarpur.name: Muzaffarpur
muzaffarpur.description: Muzaffarpur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Bihar.

vaishali.name: Vaishali
vaishali.description: Vaishali Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.[1]

gopalganj.name: Gopalganj
gopalganj.description: Gopalganj Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. It has been reserved for Scheduled Castes.

siwan.name: Siwan
siwan.description: Siwan is a Lok Sabha constituency in the state of Bihar in India. The Lok Sabha is the lower house of the Parliament of India. The constituency was formed following the States Reorganisation Act of 1956 and the constituency boundaries were readjusted by the Delimitation Order of 2008. The constituency consists of 6 Assembly segments (constituencies) of the Bihar Legislative Assembly.[1]

maharajganj.name: Maharajganj
maharajganj.description: Maharajganj is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. There is a constituency by the same name in Uttar Pradesh as well.

saran.name: Saran
saran.description: Saranis one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.[1][2] This constituency came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.[3] Before delimitation, it was Chapra (Lok Sabha constituency).

hajipur.name: Hajipur
hajipur.description: Hajipur is one of the 40 Lok Sabha constituencies in the eastern Indian state of Bihar.

ujiarpur.name: Ujiarpur
ujiarpur.description: Ujiyarpur is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. This constituency came into existence in 2008, following delimitation of the parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India.[1] All the six assembly constituency which constitute Ujiarpur Lok Sabha constituency are dominated by Kushwahas and Yadavs equally.[2][3]

samastipur.name: Samastipur
samastipur.description: Samastipur is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. It is reserved for Scheduled Castes. In the Legislative Assembly segment of this Lok Sabha constituency, Kushwaha and Yadav caste are dominant, however, due to preponderance of other caste groups, Extremely Backward Castes and Schedule Castes also determine the election results.[1]

begusarai.name: Begusarai

cheria-bariarpur.name: Cheria-Bariarpur
cheria-bariarpur.description: Cheria-Bariarpur is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar.

bachhwara.name: Bachhwara
bachhwara.description: Bachhwara Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar.

teghra.name: Teghra
teghra.description: Teghra is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar.[1] It was earlier called Barauni Assembly constituency.[2]

matihani.name: Matihani
matihani.description: Matihani Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar.

sahebpurkamal.name: Sahebpur Kamal
sahebpurkamal.description: Sahebpur Kamal (Balia) Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar.

begusarai.name: Begusarai
begusarai.description: Begusarai Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar. In 2015 Bihar Legislative Assembly election, Begusarai was one of the 36 seats to have VVPAT enabled electronic voting machines.[1][2][3]

bakhri.name: Bakhri
bakhri.description: Bakhri Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Begusarai district in the Indian state of Bihar. The seat is reserved for scheduled castes.

begusarai.description: Begusarai Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. This constituency is stronghold of Bhumihar caste. Since independence every candidate won in this constituency comes from Bhumihar community except in 2009.( Monazir Hassan won in 2009)

khagaria.name: Khagaria

simribakhtiarpur.name: Simri Bakhtiarpur
simribakhtiarpur.description: Simri Bakhtiarpur Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Saharsa district in the Indian state of Bihar.

hasanpur.name: Hasanpur
hasanpur.description: Hasanpur Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Rosera Subdivision of Samastipur district in the Indian state of Bihar.

alauli.name: Alauli
alauli.description: Alauli Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Khagaria district in the Indian state of Bihar. The seat is reserved for scheduled castes.

beldaur.name: Beldaur
beldaur.description: Beldaur Assembly Constituency is an assembly constituency in Khagaria district in the Indian state of Bihar.

parbatta.name: Parbatta
parbatta.description: Parbatta Assembly constituency is an assembly constituency in Khagaria district in the Indian state of Bihar.

khagaria.description: Khagaria Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.[1]

bhagalpur.name: Bhagalpur
bhagalpur.description: Bhagalpur (Lok Sabha constituency) is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bhagalpur in Bihar state in eastern India.

banka.name: Banka
banka.description: Banka Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. This comprises the Banka district.[1]

munger.name: Munger
munger.description: Munger Lok Sabha constituency (formerly Monghyr) is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. Mokama and Barh are also part of Munger Lok Sabha constituency which fall under Patna district.[1] It shares border with Patna Sahib Lok Sabha constituency.

nalanda.name: Nalanda
nalanda.description: Nalanda Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

patnasahib.name: Patna Sahib
patnasahib.description:
Patna Sahib Lok Sabha Constituency is one of the 543 parliamentary constituencies in India.[1] The constituency is located in Patna district in Bihar. This constituency and Lok Sabha seat is dominated by Kayastha caste. Until 2008, there was only one Lok Sabha seat for Patna, capital of Bihar. In the reorganisation effected that year, the city was awarded two seats, named Pataliputra (after the city's ancient name) and Patna Sahib. It also shares border with Munger Lok Sabha constituency.
The Voter-verified paper audit trail (VVPAT) system with EVMs was used for the first time in this Lok Sabha constituency in 2014 elections.[2]
[3]

pataliputra.name: Pataliputra
pataliputra.description: Pataliputra Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 543 parliamentary constituencies in India.[1] The constituency is located in Patna district in Bihar. Until 2008, there was only one Lok Sabha seat for Patna, capital of Bihar. In the reorganization effected that year, the city was awarded two seats, named Pataliputra (after the city's ancient name) and Patna Sahib. Pataliputra constituency has a total of 16.5 lakh electorate out of which 3 lakh are Yadavs, 1.5 lakh are Bhumihar, 1 lakh are Brahman, 3 lakh are Kurmi[2] 1 lakh are Koeri, 1.5 lakh are Muslims, rest comprises dalit voters.

arrah.name: Arrah

sandesh.name: Sandesh
sandesh.description: Sandesh Assembly constituency is one of 243 assembly seats of the Bihar Legislative Assembly. It is part of  Arrah Lok Sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz Barhara, Arrah, Agiaon (SC), Tarari, Jagdishpur and Shahpur.[1]

barhara.name: Barhara
barhara.description: Barhara Assembly constituency is one of 243 legislative assembly seats of the legislative assembly of Bihar. It is part of  Arrah lok sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz Sandesh, Arrah, Tarari, Jagdishpur, Shahpur and Agiaon (SC).[1]

arrah.name: Arrah
arrah.description: Arrah Assembly constituency is one of 243 assembly seats of the Bihar Legislative Assembly. It is part of Arrah Lok Sabha constituency along with 6 other assembly constituencies named Sandesh, Barhara, Tarari, Jagdishpur, Shahpur and Agiaon (SC).[1] Since 2015, Arrah has been one of the 36 seats to have VVPAT enabled electronic voting machines.[2][3]

agiaon.name: Agiaon
agiaon.description: Agiaon Assembly constituency is one of 243 constituencies of legislative assembly of Bihar. It is part of Arrah Lok Sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz. Barhara, Arrah, Tarari, Jagdishpur, Shahpur and Sandesh.[1]

tarari.name: Tarari
tarari.description: Tarari Assembly constituency (formerly Piro Assembly constituency) is one of 243 constituencies of legislative assembly of Bihar. It is part of Arrah Lok Sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz. Barhara, Arrah, Sandesh, Jagdishpur, Shahpur and Agiaon (SC).[1]

jagdishpur.name: Jagdishpur
jagdishpur.description: Jagdishpur Assembly constituency is one of 243 legislative assembly seats of legislative assembly of Bihar. It is part of  Arrah Lok Sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz Barhara, Arrah, Tarari, Sandesh, Shahpur and Agiaon (SC).[1]

shahpur.name: Shahpur
shahpur.description: Shahpur Assembly constituency is one of 243 legislative assembly seats of legislative assembly of Bihar. It is part of  Arrah lok sabha constituency along with other assembly constituencies viz Barhara, Arrah, Tarari, Jagdishpur, Sandesh and Agiaon (SC).[1]

arrah.description: Arrah Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Bihar state of India. It is a part of the Bhojpur district and comprises seven Assembly constituencies: Sandesh, Barhara, Arrah, Agiaon (SC), Tarari, Jagdishpur and Shahpur.

buxar.name: Buxar
buxar.description: Buxar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

sasaram.name: Sasaram
sasaram.description: Sasaram is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. It is reserved for Scheduled Castes.

karakat.name: Karakat
karakat.description: Karakat Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. This constituency came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.

jahanabad.name: Jahanabad
jahanabad.description: Jahanabad Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

aurangabad.name: Aurangabad
aurangabad.description: The Aurangabad Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

gaya.name: Gaya
gaya.description: Gaya Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

nawada.name: Nawada
nawada.description: Nawada Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India.

jamui.name: Jamui
jamui.description: Jamui Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 40 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Bihar state in eastern India. This constituency again came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.

sarguja.name: Sarguja
sarguja.description: Sarguja Lok Sabha constituency is one of the eleven Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Chhattisgarh state in central India.

raigarh.name: Raigarh
raigarh.description: Raigarh Lok Sabha constituency is one of the eleven Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Chhattisgarh state in central India.

janjgir\u2013champa.name: Janjgir–Champa
janjgir\u2013champa.description: Janjgir-Champa is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Chhattisgarh, India.

korba.name: Korba
korba.description: Korba is one of 11 Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Chhattisgarh state in India. It was formed as per the recommendation of the Delimitation Commission.

bilaspur.name: Bilaspur
bilaspur.description: Bilaspur is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Chhattisgarh.

rajnandgaon.name: Rajnandgaon
rajnandgaon.description: Rajnandgaon is a Lok Sabha constituency in the Indian state of Chhattisgarh.

durg.name: Durg
durg.description: Durg Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 11 Lok Sabha constituencies in Chhattisgarh state in central India.

raipur.name: Raipur
raipur.description: Raipur is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Chhattisgarh. The constituency consist of Raipur District and Baloda Bazar district. This Constituency is one of the important constituency in India.

mahasamund.name: Mahasamund
mahasamund.description: Mahasamund is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in the Indian state of Chhattisgarh.

bastar.name: Bastar
bastar.description: Bastar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 11 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Chhattisgarh state in central India. This Lok Sabha constituency is reserved for the Scheduled Tribes (ST) candidates.[1]

kanker.name: Kanker
kanker.description: Kanker is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Chhattisgarh.

northgoa.name: North Goa
northgoa.description: North Goa Lok Sabha constituency (formerly, Panaji Lok Sabha constituency) is one of the two Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Goa state in western India along with South Goa.[1]

southgoa.name: South Goa
southgoa.description: South Goa Lok Sabha constituency (Mormugao prior to 2008) is one of two Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Goa in western India along with North Goa.

kachchh.name: Kachchh

abdasa.name: Abdasa
abdasa.description: Abdasa is one of the 182 assembly constituency of Gujarat in India. It is a segment of Kachchh Lok Sabha constituency.[2][3] It has been numbered as constituency number 1.

mandvi.name: Mandvi
mandvi.description: Mandvi is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Kachchh district and is a segment of Kachchh Lok Sabha constituency. It is numbered as 2-Mandvi.

bhuj.name: Bhuj
bhuj.description: Bhuj is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Kachchh district. It is numbered as 3-Bhuj.

anjar.name: Anjar
anjar.description: Anjar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is numbered as 4-Anjar. It is part of Kachchh district. The current MLA for the constituency is Trikam Bijalbhai Chhanga, a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

gandhidham.name: Gandhidham
gandhidham.description: Gandhidham is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Kachchh district and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Castes and was created after the 2008 delimitation, and is numbered as 5-Gandhidham.

rapar.name: Rapar
rapar.description: Rapar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Kachchh district. It is numbered as 6-Rapar.

morbi.name: Morbi
morbi.description: Morbi is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Morbi district. It is numbered as 65-Morbi.

kachchh.description: Kachchh Lok Sabha constituency (formerly Kutch Lok Sabha constituency) is one of the 26 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Gujarat state in western India. Kachchh is the third largest constituency in India, with an area of 45,652 km2.[1] It is larger than Denmark.

banaskantha.name: Banaskantha

vav.name: Vav
vav.description: Vav is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district. It is numbered as 7-Vav.

tharad.name: Tharad
tharad.description: Tharad is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district and comes under Banaskantha Lok Sabha constituency for national elections. It came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

dhanera.name: Dhanera
dhanera.description: Dhanera is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district. It is numbered as 9-Dhanera.

danta.name: Danta
danta.description: Danta is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district .It is numbered as 10-Danta and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Tribes.

palanpur.name: Palanpur
palanpur.description: Palanpur is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district.It is numbered as 12-Palanpur.

deesa.name: Deesa
deesa.description: Deesa is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district.It is numbered as 13-Deesa.

deodar.name: Deodar
deodar.description: Deodar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district.It is numbered as 14-Deodar.

banaskantha.description: Banaskantha Lok Sabha constituency (Gujarati: બનાસકાંઠા લોકસભા મતવિસ્તાર / बनासकांठा) is one of the 26 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Gujarat state in western India.

patan.name: Patan

vadgam.name: Vadgam
vadgam.description: Vadgam is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[1][2] It is part of Banaskantha district, numbered as 11-Vadgam and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Castes. It falls under the Patan Lok Sabha constituency.

kankrej.name: Kankrej
kankrej.description: Kankrej is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Banaskantha district. It is numbered as 15-Kankrej.

radhanpur.name: Radhanpur
radhanpur.description: Radhanpur is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Patan district and is numbered as 16-Radhanpur . It is one of the seven seats which make up Patan Lok Sabha constituency.

chanasma.name: Chanasma
chanasma.description: Chanasma is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Patan district. It is numbered as 17-Chanasama.

patan.name: Patan
patan.description: Patan is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Patan district and a segment of Patan Lok Sabha constituency. It is numbered as 18-Patan.

sidhpur.name: Sidhpur
sidhpur.description: Sidhpur is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Patan district. It is numbered as 19-Sidhpur.

kheralu.name: Kheralu
kheralu.description: Kheralu is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district. It is numbered as 20-Kheralu.

patan.description: Patan (Gujarati: પાટણ લોકસભા મતવિસ્તાર) is a Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituency in Gujarat state in western India.

mahesana.name: Mahesana

unjha.name: Unjha
unjha.description: Unjha is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district, numbered as 21-Unjha and is one of the seven Vidhan Sabha segments which fall under Mahesana Lok Sabha constituency.

visnagar.name: Visnagar
visnagar.description: Visnagar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district. It is numbered as 22-Visnagar.

bechraji.name: Bechraji
bechraji.description: Bechraji is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is numbered as 23-Bechraji.

kadi.name: Kadi
kadi.description: Kadi is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district, numbered as 24-Kadi and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Castes.

mahesana.name: Mahesana
mahesana.description: Mahesana, also spelled Mehsana, is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district, numbered as 15-Mahesana and is one of the seven Vidhan Sabha seats which fall under Mahesana Lok Sabha constituency. Its current MLA is Nitinbhai Patel.

vijapur.name: Vijapur
vijapur.description: Vijapur is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Mahesana district. It is numbered as 26-Vijapur.

mansa.name: Mansa
mansa.description: Mansa is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Gandhinagar district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

mahesana.description: Mehsana Lok Sabha constituency (formerly, Mehsana Lok Sabha constituency) (Gujarati: મહેસાણા લોકસભા મતવિસ્તાર) is one of the 26 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Gujarat state in western India. It is home to the birthplace of India's current PM, Narendra Modi. It is one of the first 2 seats won by the Bharatiya Janata Party, India's current governing party and remains its stronghold, having held the seat since 1984, barring 2 exceptions.

sabarkantha.name: Sabarkantha

himatnagar.name: Himatnagar
himatnagar.description: Himatnagar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Sabarkantha district. It is numbered as 27-Himatnagar.

idar.name: Idar
idar.description: Idar is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Sabarkantha district, numbered as 28-Idar and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Castes.

khedbrahma.name: Khedbrahma
khedbrahma.description: Khedbrahma is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Sabarkantha district and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Tribes.

bhiloda.name: Bhiloda
bhiloda.description: Bhiloda is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3]

modasa.name: Modasa
modasa.description: Modasa is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Aravalli district.

bayad.name: Bayad
bayad.description: Bayad is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3]

prantij.name: Prantij
prantij.description: Prantij is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Sabarkantha district.

sabarkantha.description: Sabarkantha Lok Sabha constituency (Gujarati: સાબરકાંઠા લોકસભા મતવિસ્તાર / साबरकांठा) is one of 26 Lok Sabha (parliamentary)  constituencies in Gujarat state in western India.

gandhinagar.name: Gandhinagar

gandhinagarnorth.name: Gandhinagar North
gandhinagarnorth.description: Gandhinagar North is one of the 183 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Gandhinagar district. The seat came into existence after 2008 delimitation after division of erstwhile Gandhinagar seat and was numbered as 36-Gandhinagar North.  It is one of the seven assembly seats which make up Gandhinagar Lok Sabha seat.

kalol.name: Kalol
kalol.description: Kalol is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Gandhinagar district and is numbered as 38-Kalol. It is a part of the Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency.

sanand.name: Sanand
sanand.description: Sanand is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation and numbered as 40-Sanand.

ghatlodia.name: Ghatlodia
ghatlodia.description: Ghatlodia is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation. It is a segment of Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency.

vejalpur.name: Vejalpur
vejalpur.description: Vejalpur is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

naranpura.name: Naranpura
naranpura.description: Naranpura is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district. This seat came into existence after 2008 delimitation and it is one of the seven assembly seats which make up Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency.

sabarmati.name: Sabarmati
sabarmati.description: Sabarmati is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and is one of the seven assembly seats which make up the Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency.

gandhinagar.description: Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 26 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian Parliament) constituencies in Gujarat, a state in Western India. Gandhinagar is the capital of Gujarat. It is one of the most prestigious parliamentary constituencies in India, being represented by former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, former Deputy Prime Minister LK Advani and the current Home Minister and former BJP chief Amit Shah. The constituency was created in 1967 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Somchandbhai Solanki of the Indian National Congress (INC).

ahmedabadeast.name: Ahmedabad East

dahegam.name: Dahegam
dahegam.description: Dahegam is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Gandhinagar district.

gandhinagarsouth.name: Gandhinagar South
gandhinagarsouth.description: Gandhinagar South is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Gandhinagar district. The seat came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

vatva.name: Vatva
vatva.description: Vatva is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

nikol.name: Nikol
nikol.description: Nikol is one of the 182 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Gujarat state in India.[2][3] It is part of Ahmedabad district and it came into existence after 2008 delimitation.

naroda.name: Naroda

vadodara.description: Vadodara (formerly Baroda Lok Sabha constituency) (Gujarati: વડોદરા લોકસભા મતવિસ્તાર) is one of the 26 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian parliament) constituencies in Gujarat, a state in Western India. This constituency covers 7 out of 10 Vidhan Sabha constituencies of Vadodara district and first held elections in 1957 as Baroda Lok Sabha constituency in erstwhile Bombay State (present day Gujarat).[1] It has been known as Vadodara since the 2009 elections. Its first member of parliament (MP) was Fatehsinghrao Gaekwad of the Indian National Congress (INC) who was also re-elected in the next elections in 1962. He was the Maharaja of Baroda of the Gaekwad dynasty at the time.[2] P. C. Patel of the Swatantra Party won the election in 1967. From 1971–80, Gaekwad was MP of this constituency again firstly as a member of the Indian National Congress (Organisation) and then as a member of the INC. His younger brother, Ranjitsinh Pratapsinh Gaekwad also of the INC represented the constituency from 1980–89 for two terms before being defeated by Prakash Brahmbhatt of the Janata Dal party in the 1989 election.[3]

This constituency was created as a part of the delimitation of the parliamentary constituencies in 2008, based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.[2][3] It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament was Pralhad Joshi of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). After winning 2019 general elections Pralhad Joshi was appointed as Minister of Parliamentary Affairs, Minister of Coal, Minister of Mining on 30 May 2019 in cabinet headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

It has been a stronghold of Maharashtra Ekikaran Samiti (MES) whose candidates tend to contest as independents because it is not officially recognized as a party. udupichikmagalur.description: Udupi Chikmagalur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 28 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian parliament) constituencies in Karnataka a state in southern India. This constituency was created as part of the implementation of the delimitation of the parliamentary constituencies in 2008, based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.[2][3] It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament was D. V. Sadananda Gowda of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). Gowda was selected on 4 August 2011 to become Chief Minister (CM) of Karnataka after the previous CM B. S. Yeddyurappa resigned.[4] He therefore had to resign as MP for this seat which forced a by-election in 2012.[5] This by-election was won by K. Jayaprakash Hegde of the Indian National Congress (INC). As of the latest elections in 2019, Shobha Karandlaje of the BJP represents this constituency.

This constituency was created as a part of the delimitation of the parliamentary constituencies in 2008.[2]  It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Nalin Kumar Kateel of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). As of the latest elections in 2019, Kateel represents this constituency. It comprises whole area of Dakshina Kannada district only.

The area hosts one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. Chamaraja is also part of Mysore Lok Sabha constituency.[2][3] Mysore Palace, which is in Chamaraja area, is one of the famous tourist attractions, and is known for its Dussehra celebrations.[4][5]

It encompasses Yelandur taluk, parts of Kollegal taluk and Chamarajanagar taluk.[3]

chamarajanagar.description: Chamarajanagar Assembly constituency is one of the seats in Karnataka Legislative Assembly in India. It is part of Chamarajanagar Lok Sabha seat.

gundlupet.description: Gundlupet Assembly constituency is one of the 224 electoral constituencies that form the Karnataka Legislative Assembly in the south-Indian state of Karnataka. It is part of Chamarajanagar Lok Sabha constituency.

chamarajanagar.description: Chamarajanagar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 28 Lok Sabha constituencies in Karnataka state in southern India. This constituency is reserved for the Scheduled Castes. This constituency came into existence in 1962.

kunigal.description: Kunigal Assembly constituency is one of the 224 Legislative Assembly constituencies of Karnataka state in India.[2]

rajarajeshwarinagar.description: Rajarajeshwari Nagar Assembly constituency, also known as RR Nagar, is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of the State of Karnataka, India. It is located within the Bangalore Rural Lok Sabha constituency.[1]

bangaloresouth.name: Bangalore South
bangaloresouth.description: Bangalore South Assembly seat is one of the seats in Karnataka state assembly in India. It is part of the Bangalore Rural Lok Sabha seat. Notably, the Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency does not contain the Bangalore South Assembly constituency.

anekal.name: Anekal
anekal.description: Anekal Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Rural Lok Sabha constituency.[2] It is in Bangalore Urban district and is reserved for candidates belonging to the Scheduled Castes.

magadi.name: Magadi
magadi.description: Magadi Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Rural Lok Sabha constituency.[1]

ramanagara.name: Ramanagara
ramanagara.description: Ramanagara Assembly constituency of Karnataka Vidhan Sabha is one of the constituencies located in the Ramanagara district.[1]

kanakapura.name: Kanakapura
kanakapura.description: Kanakapura Assembly constituency is one of the 224 assembly constituencies in Karnataka state in India. The constituency is one of the 8 seats which make up Bangalore Rural (Lok Sabha constituency). Ramakrishna Hegde contested a bypoll from this seat when he first became Chief Minister in 1983.

channapatna.name: Channapatna
channapatna.description: Channapatna Assembly constituency of Karnataka Assembly is one of the constituencies located in the Ramanagara district.[1][2]

bangalorerural.description: Bangalore Rural Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 28 Lok Sabha (lower house of the Indian parliament) constituencies in the South Indian state of Karnataka. This constituency was created in 2008 following the delimitation of parliamentary constituencies.

bangalorenorth.name: Bangalore North
bangalorenorth.description: Bangalore North Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 28 Lok Sabha (lower house of the Indian Parliament) constituencies in the South Indian state of Karnataka.  This constituency has been known by different names in its history. For the 1951 and every election since 1977 it has been known as Bangalore North. For the 1957 and 1962 elections it was known as Bangalore City. For the 1967 and 1971 elections it formed a constituency jointly with Bangalore South and was known as Bangalore. From 1951–73, this constituency resided in Mysore State. On 1 November 1973, Mysuru State was renamed as Karnataka.[2]

bangalorecentral.name: Bangalore Central

sarvagnanagar.name: Sarvagnanagar
sarvagnanagar.description: Sarvagnanagar is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[1][2][3]

c.v.ramannagar.name: C. V. Raman Nagar
c.v.ramannagar.description: CV Raman Nagar is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is a part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[2] As of 2023, its representative is S. Raghu of the Bharatiya Janata Party.[1]

shivajinagar.name: Shivajinagar
shivajinagar.description: Shivajinagar is one of the seats in Karnataka Legislative Assembly in India. It is a segment of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[1][2][3] After the boundaries of this constituency were redrawn in 2008 delimitation exercise, it became a stronghold of Roshan Baig. But he left Congress in 2019.

shantinagar.name: Shanti Nagar
shantinagar.description: Shanti Nagar Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[1]

gandhinagar.name: Gandhi Nagar
gandhinagar.description: Gandhi Nagar Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[1]

rajajinagar.name: Rajaji Nagar
rajajinagar.description: Rajajinagar is one of the seats in Karnataka Legislative Assembly in India. It is a segment of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha seat.[1][2]

chamrajpet.description: Chamrajpet Assembly constituency is one of the seats in Karnataka Legislative Assembly in India. It is part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha seat.

mahadevapura.name: Mahadevapura
mahadevapura.description: Mahadevapura Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.[1] The constituency is represented by PC Mohan, Member of Parliament from the Bangalore Central Lok Sabha constituency.

bangalorecentral.description: Bangalore Central is one of the 28 Lok Sabha constituencies in Karnataka state in southern India. This constituency was created in 2008 as part of delimitation.[2] It was carved out of the Bangalore North and South Lok Sabha constituencies during 2009 Indian elections.[3] It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was P. C. Mohan

bangaloresouth.name: Bangalore South

govindrajnagar.name: Govindraj Nagar

vijaynagar.name: Vijay Nagar
vijaynagar.description: Vijayanagar Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency.[1] As of 2023, it is represented by M. Krishnappa of the Indian National Congress party.[2]

basavanagudi.description: Basavanagudi Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. Basavanagudi is also part of Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency.[1] It has also been considered as the stronghold of BJP as it has been winning the constituency with huge margin everytime.[2] Congress has only won the seat once in 2004 in the span of past 45 years.

padmanabhanagar.name: Padmanabha Nagar
padmanabhanagar.description: Padmanabhanagar Assembly seat is one of the seats in Karnataka Legislative Assembly in India. It is a segment of Bangalore South Lok Sabha seat.[1][2]

b.t.m.layout.description: BTM Layout Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency.[2] It is in Bangalore Urban district.

jayanagar.name: Jayanagar
jayanagar.description: Jayanagar Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency.[1]

bommanahalli.name: Bommanahalli
bommanahalli.description: Bommanahalli Assembly constituency is one of the 225 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. Bommanahalli is also part of Bangalore South Lok Sabha constituency.[1][2][3]

bangaloresouth.description:
Bangalore South is one of the 28 Lok Sabha (Parliamentary) constituencies in Karnataka state, in southern India. 
Currently the seat is held by Tejasvi Surya of Bharatiya Janata Party who won against B. K. Hariprasad of Indian National Congress by a margin of 3,31,192 votes in the 2019 Indian general election.

chikballapur.name: Chikballapur

bagepalli.description: Bagepalli Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Chikkaballapur Lok Sabha constituency.[2]

chikkaballapur.name: Chikkaballapur
chikkaballapur.description: Chikballapur Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is a part of Chikballapur Lok Sabha constituency.[2] The results are out for the recent Assembly election 2023 and Indian National Congress's Pradeep Eshwar wins Chikkaballapur. He defeated Bharatiya Janata Party's Dr K Sudhakar by huge margin.

doddaballapur.description: Doddaballapur Assembly constituency is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a state of India. It is also part of Chikballapur Lok Sabha constituency[2] and was formerly in Mysore State.

nelamangala.name: Nelamangala
nelamangala.description: Nelamangala is one of the 224 constituencies in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly of Karnataka a south state of India. It is also part of Chikballapur Lok Sabha constituency.[2]

chikballapur.description: Chikkballapur Lok Sabha constituency, also spelled 'Chikkaballapur', is one of the 28 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Karnataka state in southern India.[1] This constituency came into existence in 1977 after the reorganisation of Indian states. It covers parts of Chikkaballapura District and Bengaluru Rural District.

manjeshwar.description: Manjeshwaram State assembly constituency is one of the 140 state legislative assembly constituencies in Kerala state in southern India. It is also one of the 7 state legislative assembly constituencies included in the Kasaragod Lok Sabha constituency.[1] As of the 2021 assembly elections, the current MLA is A. K. M. Ashraf of Indian Union Muslim League.

kasaragod.description:
Kasaragod State assembly constituency is one of the 140 state legislative assembly constituencies in Kerala state in southern India.  It is also one of the 7 state legislative assembly constituencies included in the Kasaragod Lok Sabha constituency.
[1] As of the 2021 assembly elections, the current MLA is N. A. Nellikkunnu of IUML.

udma.description: Udma State assembly constituency is one of the 140 state legislative assembly constituencies in Kerala state in southern India. It is also one of the 7 state legislative assembly constituencies included in the Kasaragod Lok Sabha constituency.[1] As of the 2021 assembly elections, the current MLA is C. H. Kunhambu of CPI(M).

kanhangad.description:
Kanhangad State assembly constituency is one of the 140 state legislative assembly constituencies in Kerala state in southern India.  It is also one of the 7 state legislative assembly constituencies included in the Kasaragod Lok Sabha constituency.

vidisha.description: Vidisha Assembly constituency Vidhan Sabha seat is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha[2] (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India. This constituency came into existence in 1957, as one of the Vidhan Sabha constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state. Presently INC's Shashank Bhargava is the MLA from this constituency. He was preceded by Kalyan Singh Thakur in 2014 when the by-election for this seat was held in 2014 after CM of Madhya Pradesh Shivraj Singh Chouhan resigned from this constituency post registering victory at two seats Budhni and Vidisha Assembly constituency.

bhopalmadhya.name: Bhopal Madhya
bhopalmadhya.description:
Bhopal Madhya Assembly constituency is one of the 230 constituencies of Madhya Pradesh. It comes under Bhopal district.
In Bhopal Madhya Vidhan Sabha all major parties including  BJP and Congress will fight election face to face. The other parties that is BSP, Samajwadi party and Aam Aadmi Party are also in the race. There are also some local political parties in the Bhopal Madhya election 2018. Vidhan Sabha Bhopal Madhya is the most difficult and important seat for the political parties to win. The main competition is in Vidhan Sabha Bhopal Madhya seat as the headquarters of Bhopal Seat.

This constituency was renamed as Ratlam in 2008, following delimitation of the parliamentary constituencies.[1] This constituency covers the entire Alirajpur and Jhabua districts and part of Ratlam district.

indore-2.name: Indore-2
indore-2.description: Indore-2 Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2]

indore-3.name: Indore-3
indore-3.description: Indore-3 Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1]

indore-4.name: Indore-4

indore-5.name: Indore-5
indore-5.description: Indore-5 Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1]

rau.name: Rau
rau.description: Rau Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1]

sanwer.name: Sanwer
sanwer.description: Sanwer Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1] It is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled caste from its inception.

indore.description: Indore Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 29 Lok Sabha constituencies in Madhya Pradesh state in central India. This constituency covers most of the Indore district.

khargone.name: Khargone

maheshwar.name: Maheshwar
maheshwar.description:
Maheshwar Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]
BJP leader Rajkumar Mev represents the constituency in the Madhya Pradesh Vidhan Sabha.[4]

kasrawad.name: Kasrawad
kasrawad.description: Kasrawad Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

khargone.name: Khargone
khargone.description: Khargone Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

bhagwanpura.name: Bhagwanpura
bhagwanpura.description: Bhagwanpura Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

sendhawa.name: Sendhawa
sendhawa.description: Sendhwa Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3] It is part of Barwani District.

rajpur.name: Rajpur
rajpur.description: Rajpur Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh.[1][2][3]

pansemal.name: Pansemal
pansemal.description: Pansemal Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

barwani.name: Barwani
barwani.description: Barwani Assembly constituency is one of eight assembly constituencies in the Khargone (Lok Sabha constituency), this assembly constituency is numbered 190 amongst 230 constituencies. It is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled Tribes.

khargone.description: Khargone Lok Sabha constituency (Hindi: खरगौन लोकसभा निर्वाचन क्षेत्र) is one of the 29 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh state in central India. This constituency came into existence in 1962. It is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled Tribes and covers the entire Barwani district and part of Khargone district.

khandwa.name: Khandwa

bagli.name: Bagli
bagli.description: Bagli (बागली) Assembly constituency, also spelled Bagali, is one of the seats in Madhya Pradesh Legislative Assembly in India. It is a segment of Khandwa Lok Sabha constituency.[1][2][3]

mandhata.name: Mandhata
mandhata.description: Mandhata is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3] It is part of Khandwa District.

khandwa.name: Khandwa
khandwa.description: Khandwa Assembly constituency is one of the 230 constituencies in the Madhya Pradesh Legislative Assembly of Madhya Pradesh a central state of India. It is also part of Khandwa Lok Sabha constituency[1] and is a reserved seat for the Scheduled castes (SC).

pandhana.name: Pandhana
pandhana.description: Pandhana Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

nepanagar.name: Nepanagar
nepanagar.description: Nepanagar Assembly constituency is one of the 230 constituencies in the Madhya Pradesh Legislative Assembly of Madhya Pradesh a central state of India. Nepanagar is also part of Khandwa Lok Sabha constituency.[1] It is a reserved seat for the Scheduled Tribe (ST).[2]

burhanpur.name: Burhanpur
burhanpur.description: Burhanpur Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

bhikangaon.name: Bhikangaon
bhikangaon.description: Bhikangaon Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

badwaha.name: Badwaha
badwaha.description: Badwaha Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

khandwa.description: Khandwa Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 29 Lok Sabha constituencies in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. This Khandwa constituency came into existence in 1957. It covers the entire Burhanpur district and parts of Dewas, Khandwa and Khargone districts.

betul.name: Betul

multai.name: Multai
multai.description: Multai is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

amla.name: Amla
amla.description: Amla is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[2][3][4]

betul.name: Betul
betul.description: Betul Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2]

ghoradongri.name: Ghoradongri
ghoradongri.description: Ghoradongri Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India. Ghoradingri comes under Betul (Lok Sabha constituency).[1][2][3] It is a reserved seat for the Scheduled tribes (ST).

bhainsdehi.name: Bhainsdehi
bhainsdehi.description: Bhainsdehi is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

timarni.name: Timarni
timarni.description: Timarni Assembly constituency is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

harda.name: Harda
harda.description: Harda is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state, in central India.[1][2][3]

harsud.name: Harsud
harsud.description: Harsud is one of the 230 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1][2][3]

betul.description: Betul Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 29 Lok Sabha constituencies in Madhya Pradesh state in central India.[1] This constituency is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled Tribes. It covers the entire Betul and Harda districts and part of Khandwa district.

nandurbar.name: Nandurbar

akkalkuwa.name: Akkalkuwa
akkalkuwa.description: It is part of the Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Shahada, Nandurbar and Navapur in the Nandurbar district and Sakri and Shirpur in the Dhule district.

shahada.name: Shahada
shahada.description: It is part of the Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Navapur, Nandurbar and Akkalkuwa in the Nandurbar district and Sakri and Shirpur in the Dhule district.

nandurbar.name: Nandurbar
nandurbar.description: Nandurbar Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency is located in the Nandurbar district and it is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled tribes.[1] It is currently held by Vijaykumar Gavit of the BJP, who is former State Minister for Medical Education and Horticulture.

navapur.name: Navapur
navapur.description: It is part of the Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Shahada, Nandurbar and Akkalkuwa in the Nandurbar district and Sakri and Shirpur in the Dhule district.

sakri.name: Sakri
sakri.description: It is part of the Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Shirpur in Dhule district and Akkalkuwa, Navapur, Nandurbar and Shahada in the Nandurbar district.

shirpur.name: Shirpur
shirpur.description: It is part of the Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Sakri in the Dhule district and Akkalkuwa, Navapur, Nandurbar and Shahada in the Nandurbar district.

nandurbar.description: Nandurbar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. Presently, four of its Vidhan Sabha segments are located in Nandurbar district, while the other two segments are located in Dhule district.[1]

dhule.name: Dhule

dhulerural.name: Dhule Rural
dhulerural.description: It is part of the Dhule Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Dhule City and Sindkheda in Dhule district and Malegaon Central, Malegaon Outer and  Baglan in the Nashik district.

dhulecity.name: Dhule City
dhulecity.description: Dhule City Assembly constituency is one of the five constituencies of the Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) located in Dhule district of the state in western India.[2][3]

sindkheda.name: Sindkheda
sindkheda.description: This Vidhan Sabha segment is a part of the Dhule Lok Sabha constituency[2] along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely, Dhule Rural and Dhule City from the Dhule district and Malegaon Central, Malegaon Outer and Baglan in the Nashik district.

malegaoncentral.name: Malegaon Central
malegaoncentral.description: Malegaon Central Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in western India.[2]

malegaonouter.name: Malegaon Outer
malegaonouter.description:
Before the delimitation of Vidhan Sabha constituencies in 2008, Dabhadi (74) was a constituency of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly between 1977-2004.
[2]
The Malegaon Outer (115) constituency belongs to the Dhule parliamentary constituency

dhule.description: Dhule Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.

jalgaon.name: Jalgaon

jalgaoncity.name: Jalgaon City
jalgaoncity.description: Jalgaon City (constituency number 13) is one of the 11 Vidhan Sabha constituencies located in Jalgaon district.[1] This constituency covers Jalgaon Municipal Corporation and part of Jalgaon taluka of the district. The number of electors in 2009 were 308,762 (male 164,987, female 143,775).[2]

jalgaonrural.name: Jalgaon Rural
jalgaonrural.description: It is a part of the Jalgaon (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other assembly constituencies, viz Jalgaon City, Erandol Assembly constituency, Amalner Assembly constituency, Chalisgaon and Pachora.

amalner.name: Amalner
amalner.description: It is part of the Jalgaon Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments of this district, namely Jalgaon City, Jalgaon Rural, Erandol, Chalisgaon and Pachora.

erandol.name: Erandol
erandol.description: It is part of the Jalgaon Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments of this district, namely Jalgaon City, Jalgaon Rural, Amalner, Chalisgaon and Pachora.

chalisgaon.name: Chalisgaon
chalisgaon.description: Chalisgaon is part of the Jalgaon Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments of this district, namely Jalgaon City, Jalgaon Rural, Erandol, Amalner and Pachora.

pachora.name: Pachora
pachora.description: It is part of the Jalgaon Lok Sabha constituency along with another five Vidhan Sabha segments of this district, namely Jalgaon City, Jalgaon Rural, Erandol, Amalner and Chalisgaon.

jalgaon.description: Jalgaon Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.

raver.name: Raver

chopda.name: Chopda
chopda.description: Chopda Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.[1] This constituency is located in the Jalgaon district and it is reserved for the candidates belonging to Scheduled tribes.[2] It is currently held by Jagdishchandra Walvi of the Nationalist Congress Party.

raver.name: Raver
raver.description: Raver Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency is located in the Jalgaon district.[1]

bhusawal.name: Bhusawal
bhusawal.description: Bhusawal is part of the Raver Lok Sabha constituency along with four other Vidhan Sabha segments in this district, namely Chopda, Raver, Jamner and Muktainagar and one Vidhan Sabha segment in the adjoining Buldhana district, Malkapur.

jamner.name: Jamner
jamner.description: Jamner is part of the Raver Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Bhusawal, Chopda, Muktainagar and Raver in Jalgaon district and Malkapur in the adjoining Buldhana district.

muktainagar.name: Muktainagar
muktainagar.description: Chandrakant Nimba Patil is the current MLA from the constituency.[2]

malkapur.name: Malkapur
malkapur.description: Malkapur Assembly constituency is one of the seven constituencies of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly located in the Buldhana district.

raver.description: Raver Lok Sabha constituency  is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian parliament) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency was created on 19 February 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted on 12 July 2002.[1][2] It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Haribhau Jawale of the Bharatiya Janata Party.

buldhana.name: Buldhana
Buldhana
buldhana.description: It is a part of the Buldhana Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha(assembly) constituencies, viz. Chikhali,  Sindkhed Raja,   Mehkar (SC), Khamgaon and Jalgaon (Jamod),

chikhali.name: Chikhali
chikhali.description: It is a part of the Buldhana Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha (assembly) constituencies, viz. Buldhana,  Sindkhed Raja,   Mehkar, Khamgaon and Jalgaon (Jamod),

sindkhedraja.name: Sindkhed Raja
sindkhedraja.description: It is a segment of Buldhana Lok Sabha constituency, along with five other Vidhan Sabha (Legislative Assembly) constituencies, namely Buldhana, Chikhali, Mehkar, Khamgaon and Jalgaon (Jamod).[1]

mehkar.name: Mehkar
mehkar.description: It is a part of the Buldhana (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other Vidhan Sabha (assembly) constituencies, viz. Buldhana, Chikhali,  Sindkhed Raja,    Khamgaon and Jalgaon(Jamod),

khamgaon.name: Khamgaon
khamgaon.description: It is a part of the Buldhana (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other Vidhan Sabha(assembly) constituencies, viz. Buldhana, Chikhali, Sindkhed Raja, Mehkar and Jalgaon(Jamod).

jalgaon.name: Jalgaon
jalgaon.description: Jalgaon (Jamod) Assembly constituency is a constituency of Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha. It located in the Buldhana district. It is a part of the Buldhana Lok Sabha constituency.

buldhana.description: Buldhana Lok Sabha constituency (formerly, Buldana Lok Sabha constituency) is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency largely represents  Buldhana district in the Lok Sabha of Indian parliament, except Malkapur Assembly constituency, which is part of Raver Lok Sabha constituency from Jalgaon district of Khandesh region.

akola.name: Akola

akot.name: Akot
akot.description: It is a part of the Akola (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other assembly constituencies, viz Balapur, Akola West, and Akola East, Murtizapur (SC) and Risod  from Washim district.[1]

balapur.name: Balapur
balapur.description: It is a part of the Akola (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other assembly constituencies, viz Akot, Akola West and Akola East, Murtizapur(SC)  and Risod  from the Washim district.[1]

akolawest.name: Akola West
akolawest.description: Akola is part of the Akola Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Akot, Akola East, Balapur and Murtizapur in this district and Risod in adjoining Washim district.[1]

akolaeast.name: Akola East
akolaeast.description: It is a part of the Akola (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other assembly constituencies, viz Akot, Balapur, Akola West, and Murtizapur (SC)  and Risod  from the Washim district.[1]

murtizapur.name: Murtizapur
murtizapur.description: Murtizapur Assembly constituency is one of the 288 constituencies of Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha and one of the five which are located in the Akola district. It is reserved for a Scheduled Caste candidate.

risod.name: Risod
risod.description: Risod is part of the Akola Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Akot, Balapur, Akola West, Akola East and Murtizapur, from Akola district.[1]

akola.description: Akola Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Maharashtra state in central India.

amravati.name: Amravati

badnera.name: Badnera
badnera.description: Badnera Assembly constituency is one of the 288 constituencies of Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha and one of the eight which are located in Amravati district.

amravati.name: Amravati
amravati.description: It is a part of the Amravati (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other Vidhan Sabha assembly constituencies, viz. Badnera, Teosa, Daryapur (SC), Melghat (ST) and Achalpur.[1]

teosa.name: Teosa
teosa.description: Teosa Assembly constituency is one of the 288 constituencies of Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha and one of the eight present in Amravati district.

daryapur.name: Daryapur
daryapur.description: It is a part of the Amravati (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other Vidhan Sabha assembly constituencies, viz. Badnera, Amravati, Teosa, Melghat (ST) and Achalpur.

melghat.name: Melghat
melghat.description: It is a part of the Amravati (Lok Sabha constituency) along with five other Vidhan Sabha assembly constituencies, viz. Badnera Amravati, Teosa, Daryapur (SC), and Achalpur.

achalpur.name: Achalpur
achalpur.description: Achalpur Assembly constituency is one of the 288 constituencies of Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha and one of the eight which are located in Amravati district.

amravati.description: Amravati Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Maharashtra state in western India.

wardha.name: Wardha

dhamangaonrailway.name: Dhamangaon Railway
dhamangaonrailway.description: Dhamangaon Railway Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency is part of the eight constituencies located in the Amravati district.[1]

morshi.name: Morshi
morshi.description: Morshi is part of the Wardha Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Wardha, Arvi, Deoli and Hinganghat in the Wardha district and Dhamangaon Railway in the Amravati district.[1]

arvi.name: Arvi
arvi.description: Arvi is part of the Wardha Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Wardha, Hinganghat and Deoli in Wardha district and Morshi and Dhamangaon Railway in Amravati district.[1][2][3][4][5]

deoli-pulgaon.name: Deoli-Pulgaon
deoli-pulgaon.description: Deoli-Pulgaon Assembly constituency is part of the Wardha Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Wardha, Arvi and Hinganght in Wardha district and Dhamangon Railway and Morshi in Amravati district.[2]

hinganghat.name: Hinganghat
hinganghat.description: Hinganghat is part of the Wardha Lok Sabha constituency along with five other Vidhan Sabha segments, namely Wardha, Arvi and Deoli in Wardha district and Morshi and Dhamangaon Railway in the Amravati district.[2]

wardha.name: Wardha
wardha.description: Wardha is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in western India, and is a segment of Wardha Lok Sabha constituency. This constituency is one of the four Vidhan Sabha constituencies in the Wardha district[1] and comprises parts of the Wardha and Seloo tehsils of this district.[2]
Wardha Lok Sabha constituency  is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary)  constituencies in Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency is spread over Amravati and Wardha districts.

ramtek.name: Ramtek

katol.name: Katol
katol.description: Katol Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.[1]

savner.name: Savner
savner.description: Savner Assembly constituency is one of twelve constituencies of the Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha located in the Nagpur district.[1]

hingna.name: Hingna
hingna.description: It is a part of the Ramtek (Lok Sabha constituency) (SC) from the Nagpur district.

umred.name: Umred
umred.description: It is a part of the Ramtek (Lok Sabha constituency) (SC) from Nagpur district.

kamthi.name: Kamthi
kamthi.description: It is a part of the Ramtek (Lok Sabha constituency) (SC) from Nagpur district since 2009.[3] It used to be part of Nagpur Lok Sabha seat until 2008.

ramtek.name: Ramtek
ramtek.description: It is a part of the Ramtek (Lok Sabha constituency)(SC) from Nagpur district along with five other assembly constituencies, viz Katol, Hingna, Umred(SC), Kamthi and Savner Assembly constituency.[1]

Ramtek Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the state of Maharashtra in western India. The constituency did not exist during the Indian general elections of 1951-52 for the 1st Lok Sabha. It was created for 1957 Indian general election for the 2nd Lok Sabha, with abolition of the Amravati West constituency in the neighbouring Amravati district.

nagpur.name: Nagpur

nagpursouthwest.name: Nagpur South West
nagpursouthwest.description: Nagpur South West Assembly constituency is one of the seats in Maharashtra Legislative Assembly in India. It is one of the six vidhan sabha segments of Nagpur Lok Sabha seat. The constituency is represented by former chief minister of Maharashtra and incumbent Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra Devendra Fadnavis.

nagpursouth.name: Nagpur South
nagpursouth.description: Nagpur South Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies of Maharashtra state, western India. It is one of the six assembly seats which make up Nagpur Lok Sabha seat. The Constituency Number is 53. This constituency is located in the Nagpur district. The delimitation of the constituency happened in 2008. It comprises parts of Nagpur Taluka, and Ward No. 9 to 11, 37 to 42, 73 to 78, 99 to 102 and 120 of Nagpur Municipal Corporation.[1]

nagpurwest.name: Nagpur West
nagpurwest.description: Nagpur West (constituency number 56) is one of the 12 Vidhan Sabha constituencies located in the Nagpur district.[1] It is one of the wealthiest constituencies in Nagpur. Areas where the rich and famous of Nagpur live, like Civil Lines, Byramji Town and Ramdaspeth fall in this constituency.

nagpurnorth.name: Nagpur North
nagpurnorth.description: Nagpur North is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.[1] It is one of the six assembly seats which make up  Nagpur Lok Sabha seat. The constituency is represented by Nitin Raut, who serves as minister in Government of Maharashtra.

nagpur.description: Nagpur Lok Sabha seat is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency is spread over Nagpur city and some part of Nagpur district.

bhandara\u2013gondiya.name: Bhandara–Gondiya

tumsar.name: Tumsar
tumsar.description: Tumsar Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in central India. This constituency is one of the three constituencies located in the Bhandara district.[1]

bhandara.name: Bhandara
bhandara.description: Bhandara Assembly constituency is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in central India. This constituency is one of the three constituencies located in Bhandara district.[1]

sakoli.name: Sakoli
sakoli.description: Sakoli Assembly constituency  is one of the 288 Maharashtra Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) constituencies in Maharashtra state in central India.[1] This constituency is one of the three constituencies located in the Bhandara district.[2]

arjuni-morgaon.name: Arjuni-Morgaon
arjuni-morgaon.description: Arjuni Morgaon is one of the 288 Vidhan Sabha constituency of Maharashtra state in India. This Constituency is one of the three Constituencies located in the Gondia district.[1]

tirora.name: Tirora
tirora.description:
Tirora taluka and Tirora Municipal Council, parts of Gondiya taluka viz. revenue
circle Gangazari, part of Goregaon taluka viz. revenue circle
Goregaon.[1]

gondia.name: Gondia
gondia.description:
Parts of Gondia taluka viz. revenue circles Kamtha, Ravanwadi,
Dasgaon Budruk, Gondia and Gondia Municipal Council.[1]

bhandara\u2013gondiya.description: Bhandara–Gondiya Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification on delimitation of parliamentary constituencies, based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002 and Bhandara Lok Sabha constituency ceased to exist. Three of its assembly segments are in Bhandara district, while the other three are in Gondia district.(Member of parliament) resigned recently (2014-2017).

gadchiroli\u2013chimur.name: Gadchiroli–Chimur

amgaon.name: Amgaon
amgaon.description: Amgaon is one of the four Vidhan Sabha constituencies located in the Gondia district.[1] and comprises the entire Deori, Salekasa and Amgaon tehsils of the district. This constituency is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled tribes.[1]

armori.name: Armori
armori.description: Armori is one of the three Vidhan Sabha constituencies located in Gadchiroli district.[2] and comprises the entire Desaiganj (Wadsa), Armori, Kurkheda and Korchi tehsils and part of Dhanora tehsil of the district. This constituency is reserved for the candidates belonging to the Scheduled tribes.[2]

gadchiroli.name: Gadchiroli
gadchiroli.description: The constituency comprises Gadchiroli taluka, Chamorshi taluka, parts of Dhanora Tehsil viz. revenue circles Dhanora and Chatgaon.[1]

aheri.name: Aheri

gadchiroli\u2013chimur.description: Gadchiroli–Chimur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. This constituency came into existence on 19 February 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification on delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted on 12 July 2002.[2] This seat is reserved for Scheduled Tribes. It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Marotrao Kowase of the Indian National Congress. As of the 2014 elections, it is represented by Ashok Nete of the Bharatiya Janata Party.

Dindori Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian parliament) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India. It is in Nashik district. This constituency was created on 19 February 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted 12 July 2002.[2] It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Harischandra Devram Chavan of the Bharatiya Janata Party. Dr. Bharati Pawar of the Bharatiya Janata Party is elected as Member of Parliament in General Elections 2019 Now she represents Dindori Loksabha Constituency by defeating NCP Candidate Mr Dhanraj Mahale.

This constituency was created on 19 February 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted on 12 July 2002.[2][3] The seat is reserved for Scheduled Tribes. It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Baliram Sukur Jadhav of Bahujan Vikas Aghadi. As of the 2014 election, Chintaman Vanaga of the Bharatiya Janata Party represented this constituency in the Lok Sabha. After sudden demise of Chintaman Vanaga, Bharatiya Janata Party gave ticket to Rajendra Gavit for by-elections.

In the 2019 General Elections Sunil Tatkare of NCP won the seat by margin of 31,438 votes defeating the incumbent Geetee who was also a Union Cabinet minister.[4]

As of the 2019 elections, its MP is Dr. Amol Kolhe who is serving in his first term from this constituency.

This Constituency Consist 2056860 (20 Lack 56 thousand and 860) Voters In which 1086818 (Lack 86 Thousand 818) Male's, 970037 (9 Lack 70 Thousand 37) Female's and 5 other's until 4 October 2019.

This constituency is located in the Latur district. It is the 16th largest city in Maharashtra with district headquarter located in the city. The district comes under Marathwada region of Maharashtra, geographically located between 17°52′ North to 18°50′ North and 76°18′ East to 79°12′ East in the Deccan plateau. It has an average elevation of 631 metres (2,070 ft) above mean sea level. The entire district is on the Balaghat plateau, 540 to 638 metres from the mean sea level.[1]
